thread.title: Fairfax finally sells Melbourne print site
thread.title_full: Fairfax finally sells Melbourne print site

title: Fairfax finally sells Melbourne print site
text:
Tue, Aug 4, 2015, 3:56 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 4 mins. Fairfax finally sells Melbourne print site AAP – 13 minutes ago View Photo 

Fairfax Media has sold its printing site near Melbourne Airport to a luxury car dealer for $16 million. 
The Tullamarine printing facility was closed in 2014, just over 10 years after it opened. 
It has taken much longer to sell than the company anticipated, and the price is lower than a previous sale agreement that failed to eventuate. 
The site has been sold to Bobby Zagame, the managing director of Ferrari, Maserati, Lamborghini and Lotus dealer the Zagame Group, and contracts are expected to settle on September 21. 
Fairfax's closure of its Sydney and Melbourne printing sites, in favour of printing in regional centres, was part of the company's major cost cutting drive aimed at improving its financial performance. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Trade balance in deficit in June AAP
